Job Title: Sr. Manager, FP&A

Location: San Diego, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
About Pacira

Pacira BioSciences, Inc. is a leading provider of non-opioid pain management and regenerative health solutions dedicated to improving outcomes for health care practitioners and their patients.

Each of our 3 marketed products, both in pharmaceutical and medical device, represent cutting edge technologies for pain management.

We have 700+ employees and have averaged double digit growth year over year for the past 5 years, with $500M in revenue. We are small enough for you to make your mark, and big enough for you to learn and grow!

We have facilities in New Jersey, California and Florida. Our San Diego, CA campus is a world class manufacturing and R&D facility. We are rapidly growing and have opportunities across all of our sites and functional areas.

Why work with us?

Rarely do you have an opportunity to do work that really matters. What drives us is our mission. What makes us successful are our people. At Pacira, you are part of an inclusive culture that fosters collaboration, growth, and innovative thinking – a place where you can make an impact and help change the standard of care in non-opioid pain management. Be part of our movement, let’s pursue excellence together.

The Sr. Manager SCC FP&A will be responsible for financial analysis, management reporting, planning, and forecasting and ad hoc analysis for the SCC COGS and Product Development departments including capital expenditures. This position will also coordinate key activities across the sites.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

 Manage the budget and forecasting process for SCC commercial products:  Interact with SCC dept managers and leaders to prepare annual budget and latest estimates  Document and understand assumptions, risks, and opportunities  Prepare documentation, including presentations, trend, and variance analysis  Support Dir. SCC site Controller with LRP assumptions and documentation  Finance Liaison with Pacira SCC management:  Assist with the facilitation of contract review and accurate coding of purchase requisitions and whether budgeted  Review significant invoices and support resolution of invoicing discrepancies  Assist with training the business on financial policies and provide financial support to SCC site decision making  Timely review purchase requisitions to ensure accuracy of coding, consistency with budget and business justifications  Support the planning, acquisition, accruals, impairment, or disposal of fixed assets  Provide insight on cost savings activities and lead cost reduction initiatives  Manage the month-end close process for operations including:  Interact with SCC department owners to determine and prepare monthly accruals & prepaids  Prepare assigned account reconciliations for accrual & prepaids accounts  Prepare spend by department and analysis of budget versus actual including profit review commentary  Support detailed Income Statement analytics for cost of goods sold and assist with balance sheet analytic for relevant accounts  Prepare, communicate, and present financial results including site Gross Margin analysis, trends, and Key Performance Indicators with explanation of business drivers  Develop and document policies and procedures for monthly close. Ensure proper documentation and support is maintained  Other:  Identify and implement process efficiencies to ensure an efficient and effective close  Support ongoing Sarbanes-Oxley internal control testing  Liaison with external auditors and other vendors to ensure requests are met timely  Other ad hoc analysis and projects as deemed appropriate 
Supervisory Responsibilities

This position is an individual contributor, (0) direct reports.

Interaction

Works closely with Accounting, FP&A, auditors and relevant Pacira business partners, and key vendors. Travel is estimated at 5%.

Education And Experience

 Bachelor’s degree in accounting/finance from accredited college or university  CPA or MBA preferred  Minimum of 5-7 years of related experience in Finance and Accounting  Manufacturing site preferred, pharmaceutical industry experience a plus 

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

 High proficiency in MS Office including Excel (expert level), Word, Power Point and Outlook  Experience with forecasting software tools (OneStream) a plus  General accounting principles and the preparation and implementation of accounting policies, systems, and procedures.  Demonstrated current knowledge of GAAP and SOX with an understanding of internal accounting controls.  Demonstrated excellent analytical abilities  Excellent oral and written English communication skills  Experience working in a fast-paced environment in a multi-product, multi-site manufacturing organization.  Proven ability to manage multiple projects, set priorities and meet deadlines 

Benefits

 Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision Coverage  Flexible Spending Account & Health Savings Account with Company match  Employee Assistance Program  Mental Health Resources  Disability Coverage  Life insurance  Critical Illness and Accident Insurance  Legal and Identity Theft Protection  Pet Insurance  Fertility and Maternity Assistance  401(k) with company match  Flexible Time Off (FTO) and 11 paid holidays  Paid Parental Leave 

The base pay range for this role in California is $112,000 per year to $154,000 per year.

The range is what we reasonably expect to pay for this role. The range considers a wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: geographic markets, business or organizational needs, skill sets, experience, training, licensure, and certifications.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
